intro: Cardamine glacialis var. soehrensii, commonly known as the alpine buttercup, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky or alpine habitats, often in mountainous areas with cool, temperate climates. It is known for its limited distribution and is considered a specialist species adapted to specific environmental conditions. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, it is often of interest to botanists and conservationists.
